posts.author: Andare
posts.content:
Was working on a dwarven warrior build to play in a party.  I was wanting a strength build with heavy armor (just because) and was debating between a F-WM-CoT build or a F-Bd-CoT build ... trying to optimize AB, AC and saves.  And then I recalled the attribute boosts from RDD.  The +8 STR was very enticing; and then I started looking at the boosts from the Bard's Song and Curse Song ... and could see a path forward.  16 levels of bard seemed optimimum for the song; and 10 levels of RDD left 14 levels of fighter.

So, it was off to the spreadsheet ... and then I was left with some hard choices (which really were not all that difficult for me, however, some may consider them strange or even unthinkable) ... I opted to ignor the bard spells ... yes, ignore them all together.  16 levels devoted to bard, and can't cast a single spell.  :(

For me, it wasn't that tough of a choice.  I wanted heavy armor (and shield) .. and bards being arcane casters suffer heavy penalties for attempting spells with heavy armor.  There is a solution, the Still Spell feat ... but it is another feat.  And then to "do it right" you'd likely need Combat Casting (another feat)  and of course skill points in Concentration would become nearly mandatory.  If all of that were not reason enough, bards only get six levels of spells (and at L16 only five levels are usable without 22 points in Charisma).  And then as a level 16 spell caster, most buffs (applied while not wearing armor) are going to be dispelled when up against the first casters ... and I really hate it when that happens.  On the other hand, the bard song is undispellable and can't be interupted .. (and affects everyone in the party) a pretty good deal.

I tried to work in Lingering Song ... just really couldn't work it in early enough to be useful ... I suppose one could swap it out for Toughness at L39 ... 

I didn't list a weapon, as I'd REALLY liked to have gotten Exotic and used a Dwarven Waraxe ... but to be honest with the Dev Crit line of feats, something like a scimitar would probably be better.

There are several builds here with this class combination; but only one (that I noticed) sacrificed the spell casting as this one does;  Demos' "Dreadnought Fighter" (F24_Bd6_RDD10). http://nwnecbguild.forumer.com/topic/51 ... QX6Wvl96Cg

The Dragon Singer makes better use of the bard song by taking it up to the "sweet spot" of L16.  This will allow 8 castings each of the song and curse song per rest cycle, providing +2 AB, +5 AC from the song and an effective +2 AC and +5 AB from the curse song for an effective total of +7 AB and +7 AC to the base stats listed below.  The Taunt skill can further boost effective AB by up to +6 by lowering the opponent's AC.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I would have dropped Expertise, Improved Expertise, Improved Power Attack, and Toughness, and moved Great Cleave into pre-epic, and use Fighter feats for Epic Weapon Specialization, Overwhelming Crit, Dev Crit, Epic Prowess, and Armor Skin, leaving 4 more epic general feats free for Great Strength. That would bring the ending Strength to 40, giving you 2 more AB and damage.

On the other hand, I would have abandoned Bard spell casting the same as you. I think I have played similar builds, except for only 12 Bard levels, and Human.

posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:

That would bring the ending Strength to 40, giving you 2 more AB and damage.

On the other hand, I would have abandoned Bard spell casting the same as you. I think I have played similar builds, except for only 12 Bard levels, and Human.
Yes, good points.  My initial layout was more like that (kept the Exp though, but lowered Int to 13 and Cha to 06 and started with a 17 STR to end at 40 STR).  Certainly more optimal for a L40 build and I might opt for it in a toon intended for solo adventruring.  However, I was thinking along the lines of party play and getting the "fun" party stuff (i.e., bard song) sooner as not much time will be spent at the very high levels.

Toughness, Improved Expertise and Power Attack were basically just stuffed in the end to fill feat slots ...

Expertise is one of my favorite fighter skills (if I have the INT for it).  In party play, I like to get it early.
I wanted the bard song improvements to happen early, and needed the RDD 10 early as well ... that meant fighter was filling up the back.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: In that case, how about replacing those 6 "filler" Fighter levels with 5 more RDD (with d12 hit dice) and 1 more Bard, for a slightly stronger song? You would be replacing those 3 Fighter feats with 1 RDD feat (either Armor Skin or Epic Prowess) and +1 AC (and a stronger breath weapon).

posts.author: Andare
posts.content: Now that is a thought ... let me play with that a bit.  Thanks for the suggestion.  :)
